This certainly seems to suggest that the self—corrective powerof the U.S. economy in the l930s was very weak. Thus, the Great Depressiondoes not seem to provide evidence that large shocks are rapidly undone by the

33forces of mean reversion. Rather, it suggests that large negative shifts inaggregate demand are sometimes followed by large positive shifts, thecombination of which leaves the economy back on trend.
